citation.article-title: Plasticicumulans acidivorans gen. nov., sp. nov., a polyhydroxyalkanoate-accumulating gammaproteobacterium from a sequencing-batch bioreactor
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Plasticicumulans acidivorans sp. nov.
Plasticicumulans acidivorans (a.ci.di.vo′rans. N.L. n. acidum an acid; L. part. adj. vorans eating, devouring; N.L. part. adj. acidivorans acid-devouring).
Displays the following properties in addition to those given for the genus.
Cell shape varies from coccoid to ovoid, 1.5–1.8×3–5 µm.
Forms two colony variants, dome-like rough and flat smooth, whitish-yellowish, up to 3 mm in diameter after 72 h of incubation at 30 °C.
Accumulates up to 89 % (w/w) PHA, with storage polymers in the form of large intracellular granules.

Utilizes the following organic compounds as carbon and energy sources: acetate, propionate, butyrate, valerate, caproate, heptanoate, octanoate, nonanoate, decanoate, pyruvate, succinate, lactate, fumarate, ethanol, malate and yeast extract.
The following compounds are not utilized: hexoses (including glucose), pentoses (including arabinose), methanol, formate and H2.
Ammonium and nitrate serve as nitrogen sources.
Hydrolysis of aesculin and gelatin is negative.
Salt-sensitive; growth and respiration are inhibited in the presence of 150 mM NaCl or KCl.
The major respiratory quinone is Q-8.
The type strain is TUD-YJ37T ( = DSM 23606T = CBS 122990T), isolated from a sequencing-batch bioreactor fed with acetate.
